location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The file's contents are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 8, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file includes a letter by Ahmad Ali Khan of Rajput, written in Urdu and addressed to His Majesty the King and Parliament, London, as well as a transliteration of part of the same letter, and a note from Mr Shireff, India Office, to Mr Sutton, Foreign Office, regarding the content of Ahmadâ€™s letter. The file includes a divider which gives the subject number, the year the subject file was opened, the subject heading, and a list of correspondence references by year. This is placed at the back of the correspondence.
